title: Hilary Duff nails off-duty chic in snakeskin print trousers and a tank top as she fills up on fuel
text:
She left fans thrilled after announcing her Disney Channel show Lizzie McGuire will be getting a reboot.

And ahead of filming for the show, Hilary Duff cut a very chic figure as she filled up on fuel at her local gas station in Beverly Hills on Sunday.

The actress, 32, donned a pair of brown snakeskin print trousers and a cropped black tank top during her low-key day out.

Low-key outing: Hilary Duff cut a very chic figure as she filled up on fuel at her local gas station in Beverly Hills on Sunday

The form-fitting ensemble showcased the star's slender frame, with the cropped top displaying a peek of her taut midriff.

Hilary teamed her stylish ensemble with a pair of black, leather mules and added a simple pair of earrings and a bracelet to her look.

Meanwhile, her freshly-dyed platinum locks were left to freely tumble over her shoulders, with Hilary wearing very little make-up for the trip.

Her appearance comes after it was announced that she would be stepping back into the role of Lizzie McGuire, with the reboot announced in August.

Style Queen: The actress, 32, donned a pair of brown snakeskin print trousers and a cropped black tank top during her low-key day out

Though it's not slated to be released until 2020, the star recently lightened her hair in preparation for the upcoming reboot, and her hairstylist, Nikki Lee, took to Instagram to share a photo of the results.

'Never in a million years did I think I would be doing Lizzie’s color!' she wrote in the caption.

'Well dreams do come true! Thank you @hilaryduff for trusting me to create the perfect blonde for the next chapter of Lizzie Mcguire!'

In the new Lizzie McGuire series, Hilary will play an older and wiser version of her character from the early-2000s Disney Channel show.

She's back! Though it's not slated to be released until 2020, the star recently had her hair lightened by stylist Nikki Lee, who took to Instagram to share a photo of the results

Lizzie will return to the small-screen as a 30-year-old who works as an apprentice to an NYC decorator.

After the show was announced, Hilary told People that she felt it was the 'right' time for the show to come back, since the stages of life that Lizzie and target audiences would be in, coincide with one another.

'The conversations have gone on for a couple of years and the timing just didn’t seem right and now Lizzie is turning 30,' she said.

'For me, she was everybody’s best friend and she was there for us… entering your 30s is a really big deal.'

'I think it’s the right time to set back in and have her go along with you in your 30s and all the fun times, and all of the big monumental moments, and all of the challenges that you’re faced with,' she said.

Coming back: In the new show Lizzie is now a 30-year-old millennial, and the show will see her attempt to navigate her way through life in New York City , it was reported by People

Returning: 'I think it’s the right time to set back in and have her go along with you in your 30s and all the fun times, and all of the big monumental moments'

Meanwhile, she gave a hint of what's to come in the highly anticipated show during an interview with E!

She said: 'I have said this before, but for me coming back when she’s 30 and she’s not in a marriage and she’s not having a baby and she’s not doing all the things that I have already done in my life, that story is really exciting for me.'

She added: 'I think to myself, where can we go? What are the struggles of a 30-year-old right now? What are the pressures that life throws in front of a woman who is 30 and doesn’t have all the things yet? And for me, that’s Lizzie McGuire.'

Hinting about potential story lines for her much loved character, she continued: 'Maybe at the end of the series we see her having a baby? You know, maybe it’s hard for her to get pregnant? Maybe there is something bad happening on her 30th birthday in the first episode? Maybe she’s going to be in her childhood bedroom in the first episode? I don’t know! There’s all this fun!'

Since her time on the beloved children's show, Hilary has gone on to become a mother to son Luca, seven, and daughter Banks, 11 months.

Hilary and Matthew Koma announced their engagement earlier this year, after welcoming their daughter into the world last October.
